title: Privacy Policy
section1_intro: This Privacy Policy explains how ChipGlobe GmbH (“we”, “us”, “our”) collects, uses, and protects your personal data when you visit our website or use our mobile app. Personal data refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.
section1_definition: Personal data refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.
section1_responsible: Who is responsible for data processing?
section1_collect: How do we collect your data?
section1_collect1: Data you provide: Information you enter in a contact form, when registering for an account, submitting inquiries, or using the app.
section1_collect2: Data collected automatically: Technical information such as IP address, device type, operating system, browser or app version, and access time is automatically collected when you visit our website or use our app.
section1_use: What do we use your data for?
section1_use1: To ensure proper operation of our website and app.
section1_use2: To provide and improve our services and user experience.
section1_use3: To communicate with you (e.g., support, inquiries, or contractual matters).
section1_rights1: Access, rectify, or erase your personal data.
section1_rights2: Restrict or object to data processing.
section1_rights3: Withdraw your consent at any time.
section1_rights5: Lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
section2_content: We take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your information confidentially and in accordance with applicable data protection laws, including the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the German Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG).
section2_purpose: Data processing is carried out in accordance with Article 6(1) GDPR:
section2_purpose2: For the performance of a contract or pre-contractual measures,
section2_purpose4: For legitimate interests such as service improvement and IT security.
section2_withdrawal_text: You may withdraw any consent you have given at any time by sending us an informal email. The lawfulness of processing prior to withdrawal remains unaffected.
section2_complaint_text: If you believe that your data has been processed unlawfully, you have the right to file a complaint with the competent data protection authority. A list of supervisory authorities is available at:
section2_portability_text: You have the right to receive the personal data you have provided in a machine-readable format or to have it transmitted to another controller, where technically feasible.
section2_security_text: Our website and app use modern encryption (TLS 1.3) and additional security measures to protect data transmissions. We also perform regular security assessments to prevent unauthorized access or data loss.
section3_heading: 3. Data Collection on Our Website and App
section3_cookies_text: We use cookies and similar technologies (e.g., local storage) to store session data, preferences, and login information.
section3_cookie_choice_text: Upon your first visit or app launch, you can select which categories of cookies to allow (necessary, functional, analytics, marketing).
section3_logs_intro: Each access to our website or app automatically generates log data, including:
section3_logs_text: These data are required for the technical operation, system security, and error diagnosis of our services.
section3_contact_text1: When you contact us via form, email, or through the app, we process your data to handle your request.
section3_contact_text2: Processing is based on your consent (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR) or, if related to a contract, Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR.
section4_google_text1: We use Google Analytics 4 with IP anonymization to analyze usage and improve performance. Data may be transferred to Google LLC in the United States under the EU-US Data Privacy Framework.
section4_google_text2: You can opt out using the browser add-on: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout?hl=en
section4_firebase_text: Our mobile app uses Firebase Analytics (Google LLC) to collect anonymous statistics on app usage, crashes, and performance to enhance user experience. These data do not identify you personally.
youtube_paragraph1: Our website and app may embed YouTube content. Provider: YouTube LLC, 901 Cherry Ave., San Bruno, CA 94066, USA.
youtube_paragraph2: Data transmission to YouTube occurs only after you consent to it (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR).
maps_paragraph1: For location features in our app, we use mapping services such as Google Maps or Apple Maps. Your IP address and device location are transmitted only if you have granted permission.
push_paragraph1: If you enable push notifications, we store an anonymous device token to send relevant updates. You can disable notifications at any time in your app settings.
section6_paragraph1: We retain personal data only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described above or as required by law.
section6_paragraph2: Once the purpose ceases or retention periods expire, data are deleted or anonymized.
section7_paragraph1: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect legal changes or improvements in our services.
section7_paragraph2: Any significant updates will be communicated through our app or on our website.
